page.title: 13 AYNHO: AGRICULTURE
page.content:
Nearly all of the land in Aynho is farmed. There are hay meadows down in the valley, and cereal and grazing on the higher land. Much of the old deer park is now farmed though about a third is still managed woodland.
There are 3 farms in this area of Aynho. {COLLEGE FARM} grows cereals and keeps horses. {NELL BRIDGE FARM} grow cereals and also they keep lots of sheep. {LOWER AYNHO GROUNDS FARM} keeps South Devon and Charolais cattle for beef. They also keep sheep. They grow cereals and grass. There is also a plum orchard on this farm. They grow 3 varieties:Marjory, Czar and Victoria. In the autumn lots of villagers come and pick the plums which are sold.
